JobTitle: TeamCenter Administrator Sr - PLM Applications - Special Operations
JobFullDesc: Description:This position is for a Senior Teamcenter/PLM Applications Specialist working for Lockheed Martin (LM) Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) supporting the SOF-GLSS program in Lexington, Kentucky.The primary role of this position is IT infrastructure administration focusing heavily on Siemens TeamCenter/Active Workspace administration along with RHEL server and webserver infrastructure support. Strong working knowledge of Integrated Material Management (IMM) and other Teamcenter application suite products, along with Windows Server and Active Directory are essential. The Administrator will also be responsible for coordinating workflows and supporting support tickets related to Teamcenter support and performance tuning.Candidate should be familiar with DoD STIGs and security patching, and will be responsible for patching, vulnerability mitigation and upgrades for existing TeamCenter landscape. Candidate will be required to comply with all DoD 8570 and security clearance requirements to maintain job eligibility.Basic Qualifications:- Support, configure, and develop TeamCenter or other PLM application and workflows- Ability to work efficiently with other TeamCenter administrators and Engineering department to translate requirements into system configuration- Ability to develop system design documentation for upgrade planning- Manage end user accounts, permissions and access rights in accordance with best-practices regarding privacy and security.- Support end users and site content managers with help ticket remediation.- Perform RHEL server administration, group policy, active directory, registry, or other server administrative tasks as needed- Review internal security vulnerability reports and STIG guidance for action.- Perform ongoing administrative tasks to ensure continued security compliance, patching updates, and overall system health- Maintain a Security+ or other IAT Level II certification is required per DoD 8570.01.- Continued eligibility for this position requires candidate to maintain, at a minimum, a Secret security clearance.Desired Skills:- Prior experience with TeamCenter workflows or similar PLM software- Familiarity with PowerShell scripts is desired- Experience with Windows Server operating systems and Active Directory. - Ability to create best practice methodologies and tools, policies and procedures, whitepapers, and other standard business communications.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
